Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the effectiveness of drinking hot water with lemons and sodium bicarbonate in curing or preventing COVID-19.
Understate: There is no evidence to support the claim, therefore it understates the lack of scientific support for the effectiveness of the remedy.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient scientific evidence to support its effectiveness in curing or preventing COVID-19.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that drinking hot water with lemons and sodium bicarbonate can alkalize the immune system, which is a pseudoscientific concept.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores alternative explanations for why Israel has seen no cases of the disease, attributing it solely to the consumption of the remedy.
